prs.title: [feat]: add support for Solana LnR token transfers

prs.title: node: Accept a bare number as a deployment id in graphman
prs.truncated_body: This makes cut&paste from various places much easier since now `sgdNNN` and just `NNN` mean the same thing for graphman

commits.message: node: Accept a bare number as a deployment id in graphman

prs.title: Async pruning
prs.truncated_body:
So far, the intial prune of a subgraph had to be done synchronously in a terminal. This PR makes it possible to modify the amount of history a subgraph should keep but have the initial and all subsequent prunes happen in the background.

To that end, this PR changes the `graphman` commands used for pruning. `graphman prune` now has subcommands:
* `graphman prune run` behaves as `graphman prune`

commits.message:
graph, store: 'graphman info': Do not get confused by copies

Because the code in primary::queries::fill_assignments used the deployment
hash to reference a deployment, it would get confused by copies since for
those several deployments have the same hash
node: Extract some formatting helpers into a module

store: Track pruning progress in the database

Also adds graphman commands to view the progress
store: Limit for how many prune runs we keep status info
store: Map the pruning status tables in the sharded schema in the primary
node: Format larger durations as days/hours/minutes
Cargo.toml: Enable line wrapping for help text in clap
store: Address review comments for tracking pruning status

prs.title: Simplify the SubgraphRunner a little
prs.truncated_body: There's lots more that could and should be done, but it's a start to make the runner more readable

commits.message:
core: Extract transact_block_state into function

Reduce the duplication between normal and wasm block processing by
factoring the common part into a function
core: block_state does not need to be mutable in transact_block_state
core: Make the handling of nonfatal errors a little less mindbending

core, graph: Specialize Cancelable a little to what we actually use

This is so we can write down types involving cancelables
core: Reduce noise by storing CancelHandle in Runner
core, graph: Factor out the decision to cancel a buggy subgraph
core: Factor refetching blocks into a method
core: A little more noise reduction
core: Reduce some noise around match_and_decode_many

prs.title: feat(proto)!: upgrade proto to cosmos sdk v0.47
prs.truncated_body:
## Description
This PR introduces the following changes to streamline proto file management:
- Introduce buf for Proto Dependency Management
- Remove Third-Party Proto Files
- The proto-swagger-gen tool now fetches third-party proto files on the fly during the build process, eliminating the need to store them locally.
- Use cosmos proto-builder to build proto files

Most of files are auto g

commits.message: feat(proto)!: upgrade proto to cosmos sdk v0.47

prs.title: devnet-sdk/devstack: test user/wallet/faucet/funder utils
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Progress towards good tx DSL integration into devstack:
- Wallet for creating Keys
- Key for chain-agnostic identity
- EOA for chain account identity (a Key coupled to an EL node)
- txplan for composing txs
- updated to integrate op-faucet as one way of backing the Faucet system component. Only in sysgo for now.
- Removal of `User` from `stack` to really make it a DSL thin

prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Enables p2p connection between L2CLs, assuming that each L2CL implements `opp2p` namespace.
Additionally added a RPC client wrapper for P2P node at op-service, to invoke them at devstack sysgo.

**Tests**

I added a `DefaultRedundancyInteropSystem` which adds ad

prs.title: op-faucet: faucet for funding acceptance-tests
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This is a new service, to fund accounts in acceptance-tests.

Any parallel acceptance tests that need funding can use the faucet-service to get test eth.

The configuration is flexible, to support multiple chains, and multiple faucets per chain (if we have different rate-limits or behaviors to customize).

The default faucet RPC per chain is available at `<ip>:<port>/chain

commits.message: op-faucet: enable in CI, fix flags

prs.truncated_body: This PR makes `ForkedAccountsTrie.Copy` also copy `ForkSource` and fixes a typo: the `vm.State` interface should be actually `state.Trie` interface.

prs.title: Add support for async RPC verification of the supervisor_checkAccessList's access checks
prs.truncated_body:
**Resolves:** #[15156](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/15156)
**Depends on:** https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/574

This PR introduces an optional RPC-based async verification mechanism to the `supervisor_checkAccessList` method which has no bearing on the `CheckAccessList()` endpoint result but increments the `access_list_verify_failure` metric in the even

commits.message: Add RPC mode for op-supervisor's access list check
Update to simplify log search algorithm
Further simplify receipt lookup to O(n) operation)

prs.truncated_body:
Addresses https://github.com/firedancer-io/firedancer/issues/4822

`fd_funk_delete` does not need to be thread-safe so we can remove the locking here, which removes the memory allocation.

prs.title: repair/shred: force complete FEC sets without coding shred info
prs.truncated_body: Needed in order to swap to new architecture. Repair shreds only arrive as data shreds, but fec_resolver cannot complete FEC sets without at least 1 coding shred. fec_repair employs a fec_set_idx lookahead to find the upper bound of a FEC set without data_cnt information, and forces completion of that FEC set in the fec_resolver.

commits.message: shred/repair: force completes API for FEC sets without coding shreds
repair: initialize fec chainer and link with fec repair

prs.title: backfill from/to on receipts for failed txs
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
if tx failed to process, it will have a receipt without from/to. This PR would backfill those addresses by parsing the original tx body upon request.

## Testing performed to validate your change
patched on node

commits.message: backfill from/to on receipts for failed txs

prs.title: Unsafe reset all fix
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
Previously the home directory wasn't being set correctly and would default to the "root" directory. Now we respect the --home flag
## Testing performed to validate your change
Tested all various combinations (with and without --home):
Ubuntu user, no --home
```
ubuntu@ip-172-31-26-120:~/sei-chain$ seid init --chain-id test test
...
ubuntu@ip-172

- In all of BuildBlock/ProcessProposal/OptimisticBuildBlock/FinalizeBlock, `PrepareStateForFork` is called with the following invariants:
  - it is done **before** the call to `FCU` to build a new EL payload if necessary
  - it is done **before** the call to `ProcessBlock` if necessary (i.e. for running a block's state-transition via `stateProcessor.Transition`)
  - it is done **after** the cal

prs.title: refactor(pulse-scheduler): improve SubscriptionParams validation
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary & Rationale
- Extract duplicated SubscriptionParam validations into a `_validateAndPrepareSubscriptionParams` helper function.
- Improve validations to prevent undesirable state and behavior:
  - Disallow subscriptions with zero feeds, since this will blow up later when indexing into empty arrays.
  - Disallow duplicate price IDs in a subscription, since this will pollute the mappin

prs.title: feat(pulse-scheduler): add permanent subscriptions, allow permissionless funding, clean up tests
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary
1. Add the ability to mark subscriptions as permanent. Permanent subscriptions disallow destructive actions, such as removing price feeds or withdrawing funds.
2. Allow anyone to fund a subscription, not just the manager.
3. Refactor tests with helper methods since they were getting a bit unwieldy.

## Rationale
1. It's valuable for some consumers to lock down a subscription so th

commits.message: feat: add permanent subscriptions, clean up tests
fix: disallow config and whitelist updates for permanent subs
fix: disallow updating isActive for permanent subscriptions

prs.title: test(pulse-scheduler): add gas benchmark
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary
- Create a gas benchmark test for PulseScheduler. Covers the most common usage patterns:
  - Updating a subscription's feeds, and then querying the prices. Will be done frequently by users and keepers.
    - For 1, 2, 8, 10, 20 feeds.
  - Querying current set of active subscriptions. Will be done frequently by keepers.
    - For 10, 100, 1000 subscriptions, where half of them are a

commits.message: test(pulse-scheduler): add gas benchmark, refactor common helpers into util

prs.title: Small optimization for Symbol.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Use `Symbol::try_from_val` in `map_new_from_linear_memory` which both ensures the proper symbol validation (which doesn't happen now) and makes the conversion slightly cheaper.

This is a non-functional protocol change: while it has to go into env for the new protocol, the only observable change is the slight reduction of CPU costs.

### Why

Implementation cleanup/optimization

commits.message:
Small optimization for Symbol.

Use `Symbol::try_from_val` in `map_new_from_linear_memory` which both ensures the proper symbol validation and makes the conversion slightly cheaper

This is a non-functional protocol change: while it has to go into env for the new protocol, the only observable change is the slight reduction of CPU costs.

Based on https://github.com/stellar/stellar-cli/pull/1977, this PR adds support for including the `ledger-stellar` crate in the additional-libs feature.

### Why

Allows for a smaller binary, and less system dependencies.

### Known limitations
N/A

prs.title: fix(deps): fix Ledger hardware wallet support
prs.truncated_body:
## Related Issues
<!-- Link issues that this PR might resolve/fix. If an issue doesn't exist, include a brief motivation for the change being made -->

## Proposed Changes

So the fix is to simply update to `ledger-filecoin-go` v1.0.1, which is all that this PR does.

## Additional Info
<!-- Callouts, links to documentation, and etc -->

When using some Ledger Nano hardware wallets, some

commits.message:
fix(deps): fix Ledger hardware wallet support

When using some Ledger Nano hardware wallets, some commands fail with:

    ERROR: finding ledger: LedgerHID device (idx 0) not found.
    Ledger LOCKED OR Other Program/Web Browser may have control of device.

Examples are `lotus wallet new secp256k1-ledger` and `lotus-shed ledger list`.

This issue was fixed upstream in https://github.com/Zondax/ledger-go/pull/40,
which then got pulled in https://github.com/Zondax/ledger-filecoin-go/pull/38,
which was released as https://github.com/Zondax/ledger-filecoin-go/releases/tag/v1.0.1.

So the fix is to simply update to `ledger-filecoin-go` v1.0.1, which is all
that this PR does.

prs.title: Modify testchain to accept current time
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Testchain now uses the devnet with the local timestamp.

This is particularly important to handle tx pool tests where the `isChainSynced` is used to determine the tx evaluation flow.
Previously the testchain was never sync'd, now it's always sync'd.

Fixes # [(issue)](https://github.com/vechain/otherviews-workboard/issues/157) and [issue](https://github.com/vechain/protocol-b
